name: Answers Beginning With 'Y' Online Trivia | Alphabetics | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which imperial unit of length is equal to three feet?
Name the long-haired ox, native to Tibet?
Name the length of time taken by the Earth to circle once round the Sun in its orbit?
Name the term used for a number of Hindu disciplines to aid the union of the soul with God?
What is the title of a James Bond film?
questions.correct: You Only Live Twice & you only live twice & You only live twice & You only live Twice
questions.explanation: You Only Live Twice & you only live twice & You only live twice & You only live Twice.

questions.text: Name the plant native to southern USA, Mexico and the West Indies whose leaves are poisonous?
Which contagious skin disease found in the humid tropics is transmitted by flies or by direct skin contact with the sores?
In the television comedy 'Bewitched', who originally played Samantha's husband Darrin Stephens. Dick _____?
Who is 'Smarter than the average bear' and lives in Jellystone National Park?
questions.explanation:
Yogi Bear & yogi bear & Yogi.

	Named after New York Yankees catcher, Yogi Berra.

questions.text: Name the city on the Hudson River in New York state, USA?
This city in northern England was the principal Roman garrison in Britain whose Latin name is Eboracum?
Japan's main port for many years and now its second-largest city?
This means 'grizzly bear' and is a spectacular national park in the Sierra Nevada range of central California?
Name the capital of Armenia?
This river in China is the longest in Asia and the third-longest in the world?
questions.correct: Yangtze & yangtze-jiang & Yangtse & yangtse-jiang & yangtze kiang & Yangtze-kiang & yangtse-kiang & yangtse kiang & chang jiang
questions.explanation: Yangtze & yangtze-jiang & Yangtse & yangtse-jiang & yangtze kiang & Yangtze-kiang & yangtse-kiang & yangtse kiang & chang jiang.

questions.text: Several battles of World War One were fought around this Belgian town?
John Lennon and Paul McCartney wrote this song so that Ringo Starr would have a lead vocal on their upcoming album 'Revolver' and it became Ringo's first number one as a singer?
questions.correct: Yellow Submarine & yellow submarine & Yellow submarine
questions.explanation: Yellow Submarine & yellow submarine & Yellow submarine.

questions.text: Who became the first man to travel faster then the speed of sound in his aircraft the 'Bell X1' on 14th October 1947. Captain Charles 'Chuck' _______?
What was the name of the satirical comedy featuring Paul Eddington as the Right Honourable James Hacker?
questions.correct: Yes Minister & yes minister & Yes, Minister & yes, minister
questions.explanation: Yes Minister & yes minister & Yes, Minister & yes, minister.

questions.text: Name the Carpenters song title which reached number two in the British pop charts in 1973?
questions.correct: Yesterday Once More & yesterday once more & Yesterday once more
questions.explanation: Yesterday Once More & yesterday once more & Yesterday once more.

questions.text: Which song from Rodgers and Hammerstein's 'Carousel' show was adopted as an anthem by supporters of Liverpool Football Club?
Which river flows through central Siberia, Russia?
Name the ceremonial guards known as Beefeaters seen at the Tower of London?
questions.correct: Yeomen of the Guard & yeomen warders & Yeoman of the Guard & yeoman of the guard & Yeomen of the guard & Yeoman of the guard
questions.explanation: Yeomen of the Guard & yeomen warders & Yeoman of the Guard & yeoman of the guard & Yeomen of the guard & Yeoman of the guard.

questions.text: What in Norse mythology is an evergreen ash tree embracing the whole universe?
Name the song that gave Elton John and lyricist Bernie Taupin their first UK and US top ten hit?
questions.correct: Your Song & your song & Your song
questions.explanation: Your Song & your song & Your song.
